title: Colombian Senator and Presidential Candidate Dies After Rally Shooting
snippets: Miguel Uribe was shot three times while giving a campaign speech in a park and had since remained in an intensive care unit in serious condition with episodes of slight improvement.

Rightwing presidential hopeful, who had been in hospital in Bogotá since shooting, has died aged 39

Miguel Uribe, the Colombian senator and presidential hopeful who was shot in the head at a campaign event in June, has died, his wife has confirmed.

Uribe, an opposition candidate with
Miguel Uribe Turbay, a Colombian senator, was shot at a campaign event in Bogotá in June and had been in intensive care since.
Mr. Uribe, a presidential hopeful, was shot in June at a campaign rally in Bogotá in an attack that shocked the nation.

summary: Miguel Uribe Turbay, a rightwing presidential candidate and Colombian senator, died at the age of 39 after being shot in the head at a campaign rally in Bogotá in June. Despite undergoing multiple surgeries and intensive care, Uribe succumbed to his injuries two months post-attack. His death has shocked the nation.

Donald Trump has announced he is nominating EJ Antoni, the chief economist at the conservative Heritage Foundation, as the next commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
President Donald Trump said late Monday he plans to nominate E.J. Antoni, the chief economist of the conservative Heritage Foundation, to become commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

summary: President Donald Trump announced his intention to nominate E.J. Antoni, a chief economist at the conservative Heritage Foundation, as the new commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). This decision follows Trump's firing of the previous commissioner, Erika McEntarfer, citing dissatisfaction with a recent jobs report and accusing her of manipulating data. Trump asserts that Antoni will provide "honest and accurate" employment data.

title: Explosion at Pennsylvania Steel Plant Kills One, Leaves One Missing
snippets: Flames and heavy smoke billow out of the plant owned by US Steel as firefighters struggle to extinguish the fire.
The massive US Steel coking plant is the largest such facility in North America.

One person has died, one is unaccounted for and 10 are injured following an explosion at a Pennsylvania steel plant on Monday, local police said.

An explosion at a US Steel plant in Pennsylvania, near Pittsburgh, has killed tw
The explosion took place at the US Steel Clairton Coke Works plant, located south of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
titles: Two dead, 10 injured in explosion at US steel plant in Pennsylvania

summary: An explosion at the US Steel Clairton Coke Works plant in Pennsylvania resulted in one death, one person missing, and 10 injuries. The incident occurred south of Pittsburgh at North America's largest coking facility. The cause of the explosion is currently unknown, and a search and rescue operation is underway for the missing individual.

title: Taylor Swift Announces 12th Album "The Life of a Showgirl"

Singer announced her 12th album at 12.12am on 12 August after a countdown, mysterious posts and teasing an appearance on her boyfriend Travis Kelce’s New Heights podcast

Taylor Swift has announced her next album, The Life of a Showgirl.

Swift is known for dropping hints and clues for
The superstar musician also shared a clip of her appearance on boyfriend and NFL Star Travis Kelce’s ‘New Heights’ podcast.

summary: Taylor Swift has announced her 12th studio album titled "The Life of a Showgirl," with details and the release date yet to be disclosed. The announcement came after a series of teasers, including a countdown and mysterious posts, culminating in a reveal at 12.12 am on 12 August. Swift also shared a clip from an upcoming appearance on her boyfriend Travis Kelce’s podcast, 'New Heights,' where more information about the album is expected to be unveiled.

U.S. levies on Chinese goods like toys, footwear and furniture could rise sharply if a deal is not approved by Tuesday’s deadline.

title: Al Jazeera Reporter and Colleagues Killed in Israeli Airstrike in Gaza
snippets: Sharif was killed when Israel targeted a tent used by media in northern Gaza, alongside six others, Al Jazeera said.
Anas al-Sharif, a reporter previously threatened by Israel, and four colleagues were killed in an Israeli airstrike.
The attack on the journalists came as Israel said it was preparing to invade and take over Gaza City.
Officials accused Anas al-Sharif of being a Hamas operative posing as a reporter. Al Jazeera says he and the other four victims all worked for the network.
Anas al-Sharif, a well-known correspondent, was among those killed. Israel said it had targeted Mr. al-Sharif, claiming he worked for Hamas, which he had denied.
Al Jazeera reporter Anas al-Sharif, 28, drew millions of followers on social media and emerged as one of the top voices in the Arab world for his chronicling of the war in Gaza.
titles: Who was Anas al-Sharif, prominent Gaza journalist killed by Israel?
Israel kills Al Jazeera journalist Anas al-Sharif in Gaza
Palestinians mourn Al Jazeera journalist Anas al-Sharif, crew in Gaza
Who Were the Al Jazeera Journalists Killed in an Israeli Strike in Gaza?
Israeli Strike Kills 5 Al Jazeera Journalists, Network Says
Prominent Al Jazeera journalist among several killed in Israeli strike on Gaza press tent
summary: Anas al-Sharif, a 28-year-old Al Jazeera reporter with a significant social media following, and four colleagues were killed in an Israeli airstrike targeting a media tent in northern Gaza. Israel has accused al-Sharif of being a Hamas operative, a claim disputed by Al Jazeera. This incident is part of a broader conflict in which nearly 270 journalists and media workers have been killed since Israel launched its war on Gaza.

title: Trump to Deploy National Guard, Control D.C. Police Amid Crime Concerns

President is deploying National Guard in response to what he calls a crime emergency, with 800 troops to be sent to DC.
US President Donald Trump claimed the city had been taken over by criminals and gangs. But police statistics show that violent crimes have decreased significantly in recent years.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiwFBVV95cUxQakxHQVgzZ19lVkx0YVpKYVlud28zb0F0bmh3UGlRU1ZRenNzNmVKNXpFcmE3NE56RjNTRklVTktLU0RSR2dfaVY5UlZMZUlORWFwWWlsNWJ0SnpkQ1V5cUt6QzZ0LWN0UDZlVUNHX2xOWXlyUFBpYzhsNm8yMmdSeS1Tc2FpU2ExTlZv?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump to deploy National Guard to D.C.

  • US politics – live
Trump is invoking Section 740 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act that places the Metropolitan Police Department under direct federal control.
titles: Americanswers…on 5 Live! Why is Donald Trump deploying the National Guard to Washington DC?

summary: President Donald Trump announced plans to deploy the National Guard and take control of Washington D.C.'s Metropolitan Police Department, citing concerns over crime and homelessness. Despite Trump's claims of the city being "overtaken" by criminals and gangs, police statistics indicate a significant decrease in violent crimes in recent years. D.C.'s mayor has criticized the comparison to a war-torn country as exaggerated and misleading. Trump's actions are based on invoking section 740 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act.

title: Paramount Secures Exclusive Rights to UFC Broadcasts in $7.7B Deal

The Paramount deal will eliminate the pay-per-view model used by ESPN in its current UFC deal, making all events available for no extra charge on Paramount+.

titles: UFC, Paramount strike new deal for $7.7 billion over 7 years - Axios

summary: Paramount has entered a seven-year, $7.7 billion agreement to become the exclusive U.S. broadcaster of Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) events, starting in 2026. This deal, the first major agreement following Paramount's merger with Skydance, will see UFC events move from ESPN to Paramount+, eliminating the current pay-per-view model and making all events available at no additional cost to subscribers.

title: Ty Simpson Named Alabama's Starting QB for 2025 Season

summary: Ty Simpson has been officially named Alabama's starting quarterback for the 2025 season, winning the position for the first time in his career. After a competitive process, Head Coach Kalen DeBoer announced the decision, choosing Simpson over Austin Mack and Keelon Russe. The Alabama football team was informed of Simpson's new role on Monday, Aug. 11, ahead of their game against FSU.

title: Ottawa Senators Secure Land for New Downtown Arena at LeBreton Flats
snippets: A new downtown arena for the Ottawa Senators has sometimes seemed like a more distant hope than a Stanley Cup. On Monday, one of those dreams took a leap forward.

OTTAWA — The Ottawa Senators are one step closer to having a new arena in the city’s downtown core. The Senators and the National Capital Commission have agreed on the sale of 4.5 hectares (11 acres) of land at LeBreton Flats for the project. The agreement of purchase and sale with Capital Spo
titles: Senators’ land purchase in LeBreton Flats gives optimism for downtown arena

summary: The Ottawa Senators have made significant progress toward building a new arena in Ottawa's downtown area by agreeing with the National Capital Commission on the purchase of 4.5 hectares (11 acres) of land at LeBreton Flats. This development moves the team closer to realizing the long-discussed project, marking a key milestone in the efforts to secure a new venue for the team.

titles: Jon Gruden vs. NFL lawsuit: Nevada Supreme Court sides with former coach in ongoing battle vs. league

The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite gained 1.2%, while the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average also saw increases. Investors are monitoring economic data and inflation concerns. The outcome is a positive market response to tech and China's monetary policy actions.

title: Parasite Evades Immune System by Blocking Pain Signals in Humans
snippets: Scientists have discovered a parasite that can sneak into your skin without you feeling a thing. The worm, Schistosoma mansoni, has evolved a way to switch off the body’s pain and itch signals, letting it invade undetected. By blocking certain nerve pathways, it avoids triggering the immune system’s
titles: The parasite that turns off your body’s pain alarm and sneaks in
summary: Scientists have discovered that the parasite Schistosoma mansoni can enter human skin unnoticed by inhibiting pain and itch signals. It achieves this by blocking specific nerve pathways, which helps it evade the immune system's response. This adaptation allows the parasite to invade the host without detection.

title: New Mammal Species Fossil Found in Chilean Patagonia
snippets: Scientists have discovered the fossil of a tiny mouse-sized mammal that lived in the time of the dinosaurs in Chilean Patagonia.
titles: Scientists find 74-million-year-old mammal fossil in Chile
summary: In Chilean Patagonia, scientists found a fossil of a small mammal that lived during the dinosaur era. The discovery sheds light on ancient ecosystems. The fossil represents a new species, named Eomurucutuia diasae. This finding contributes to understanding prehistoric biodiversity and the evolution of mammals.

title: Quantum Entanglement Achieved at Room Temperature, Boosting Computing Prospects
titles: Room-Temperature Quantum Breakthrough Stuns Physicists
summary: Physicists have achieved a significant breakthrough by demonstrating quantum entanglement at room temperature, a development that could significantly advance quantum computing and communication technologies. This achievement, previously thought to be possible only at extremely low temperatures, opens new pathways for practical quantum applications in everyday environments.

title: Mexico City's Axolotls Now Rare in Wild, Hard to Spot
snippets: Sixty years ago, residents of a canal-crossed borough in Mexico City could pluck axolotls—the large salamander reminiscent of a tiny dragon—out of the water with their hands because they were so plentiful. Now it's almost impossible to find them in the wild.
titles: Scientists search for DNA of an endangered salamander in Mexico City's canals
summary: Residents of a canal-crossed borough in Mexico City used to easily find axolotls in the water 60 years ago. These large salamanders, resembling tiny dragons, are now scarce in the wild, making it difficult to spot them.

title: New Mineral in Meteorite Redefines Heat Conduction Rules
titles: Scientists Stunned by Alien Mineral That Breaks the Rules of Heat
summary: Scientists have discovered a novel mineral in a meteorite that exhibits unique heat conduction properties, challenging existing rules of thermal physics. This alien mineral, found in a space rock, has the ability to conduct heat in a way that contradicts previously understood principles, potentially leading to new advancements in materials science and engineering. The discovery has left researchers both surprised and intrigued by its implications for future technology.

title: TDK backs Ultraviolette with $21M to take India-made electric motorcycles global
snippets: Ultraviolette aims to expand its electric motorcycles to 40 European countries, as well as Latin America and Southeast Asia.
titles: TDK backs Ultraviolette with $21M to take India-made electric motorcycles global

title: Self-Forgiveness Requires Addressing Moral Injuries, Study Finds
snippets: Flinders University researchers found that forgiving yourself isn’t just about letting go. People stuck in guilt and shame often feel trapped in the past, and true healing comes from addressing deeper moral injuries and restoring a sense of control.
titles: Trapped in guilt and shame? Science explains why you can’t let go
summary: Researchers at Flinders University discovered that self-forgiveness involves more than just moving on from guilt and shame. True healing requires addressing deeper moral injuries and regaining a sense of control, suggesting that individuals who feel trapped by their past need to confront and reconcile with their deeper moral wrongdoings to achieve genuine recovery.

title: Seoul-based Datumo raises $15.5M to take on Scale AI, backed by Salesforce
snippets: Datumo began as an AI data labeling company and now wants to help businesses build safer AI with tools and data that enable testing, monitoring, and improving their models — without requiring technical expertise.
titles: Seoul-based Datumo raises $15.5M to take on Scale AI, backed by Salesforce

title: Pronto’s 10-minute house help pitch sparked a 3.6x valuation jump in just 90 days
snippets: Pronto has raised $11 million in an all-equity Series A round co-led by General Catalyst and Glade Brook Capital at a post-money valuation of $45 million.
titles: Pronto’s 10-minute house help pitch sparked a 3.6x valuation jump in just 90 days
